item.title: searchblox ami smoke test
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysic Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Smoke test for Searchblox AMI

Revision History:
    2019-03-08 14:44:41 - Version 1 created by bao

Details: 

- Ensure that ssh into each server (index & 2 search) is successful
- Once license is applied to each server, ensure that Searchblox application starts without errors in status.log. Use the following command to start the application:
service searchblox start
- Ensure that login to the admin console UI for each server (index & 2 search) using default admin login is successful
- Spot-test indexing of Collections and ensure no errors in status.log
- Ensure that the Collection UI is accessible


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: searchblox licensing
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Searchblox licensing

Revision History:
    2019-09-09 21:32:48 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Searchblox licensing

To apply a new SearchBlox license

1) stop searchblox
2) backup the existing license
cd /opt/searchblox/webapps/searchblox/WEB-INF/
cp license.xml license.xml.bak (or similar)
replace the contents of license.xml with that of the new license
3) start searchblox
4) repeat 1-3 for search servers
5) verify that you can log into the frontend, and go to Admin > License to confirm the new license has been applied

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```
